doc.after: Dubai Airport has two runways, 12R/30L is 4,450Â m ÃÂ 60Â m (14,600Â ft ÃÂ 200Â ft), 12L/30R is 4,000Â m ÃÂ 60Â m (13,120Â ft ÃÂ 200Â ft). The runways are equipped with four sets of ILS to guide landing aircraft safely under very poor weather conditions. The runways were recently expanded to accommodate the Airbus A380.[125] In 2009, it was announced that the airport installed a Category III landing system, allowing planes to land in low visibility conditions, such as fog. This system will be the first of its kind in the United Arab Emirates.[126]
